introduction.title: Liberty Corps: Preservation Through Authority
introduction.tagline: Stabilize the park. Enforce the border. Make the canyon compliant.
introduction.description: From the maps of Liberty City, Coffin Canyon is not chaos. It is a Forbidden National Park: a vast, federally claimed preserve set aside for study, stabilization, and eventual development under the authority of the United States of Liberty. Entry without permit is illegal. Resource extraction without oversight is theft. Armed presence without sanction is sedition. That anyone disputes this is… unfortunate. The Liberty Corps exists to resolve that misunderstanding.
introduction.philosophy: The Liberty Corps believes in preservation—and understands that preservation requires decisive action. Unchecked monsters threaten survey teams. Unregulated gangs destabilize claims. Unlicensed mystics interfere with classified research. The canyon cannot be protected if it is allowed to remain wild. Monsters are hazards and unlawful presences; if they can be studied, cataloged, or contained, they will be. If they interfere with infrastructure or personnel, they will be put down. This is not cruelty. It is stewardship. Patriotism is not pageantry—it is procedure.
introduction.history: For decades, Coffin Canyon was quarantined, studied from afar, and written off as too costly to tame. That has changed. Silver veins demand oversight. Thyr demands control. Monsters demand management. The Liberty Corps has been dispatched to secure the park, enforce federal exclusion, and prepare Coffin Canyon for responsible use—checkpoints, forts, railheads, controlled extraction, and where necessary, lethal intervention. Progress does not ask permission.

core_values: Containment, arrest, or removal of unlawful presences
what_they_fight_for: A stabilized, productive Coffin Canyon under federal control
what_they_fight_against: Uncontrolled monsters as hazards and occult contamination

reputation.allies_see_them_as: Immaculate professionals bringing stability, logistics, and security to a hostile preserve
reputation.enemies_see_them_as: Occupation forces—paperwork-backed violence with steam and steel
reputation.monsters_see_them_as: Cages, chains, and gunfire—jurisdiction made physical
reputation.the_canyon_sees_them_as: Flags in the dust. Checkpoints at the throat. A claim made real.

how_they_see_others.monster_rangers: Well-meaning but misguided. Their sentimentality undermines containment and emboldens threats. Tolerated—for now—under watchful files and standing orders to leave.
how_they_see_others.shine_riders: Criminal trespassers. Poachers. Vandals. Arrest on sight. Recover stolen assets where possible.
how_they_see_others.monsterologists: Once sanctioned partners under classified agreements—now untrustworthy and driven by greed. Unwelcome trespassers on Liberty’s hallowed ground.

faction_identity.on_monsters: Monsters are illegal occult foreigners—unregistered entities operating inside a federally restricted National Park without permit, citizenship, or recognized legal standing. Some may be temporarily tolerated for study, containment, or sanctioned use. Most are subject to removal, neutralization, or classified disposition. This is not hatred. This is enforcement. Liberty does not negotiate with unlawful presences. Liberty cleans its borders.
faction_identity.uncle_liberty: There are contingencies the Corps does not discuss publicly. One of them is Uncle Liberty: the first President of the United States of Liberty, sustained beyond mortality by steam, steel, and duty. Uncle Liberty is not deployed lightly. He is a national response asset. When he appears, it means the situation has escalated beyond local authority, beyond negotiation, beyond patience. Liberty itself has deemed the canyon’s condition unacceptable. And Liberty will be obeyed.

faction_mechanics.signature_ability_description: Liberty Corps wins by turning resistance into compliance: restrain, arrest, transport, and extract. They control space with pins, lockdowns, and disciplined advance—then score through removal and zone stability.
faction_mechanics.playstyle: Zone-control enforcers who secure areas, expand outward, and escalate deliberately. They prefer tidy battlefields: pinned lanes, denied reactions, constrained movement, and arrests/extractions backed by steam hardware and command authority.
strengths: Excellent movement denial (pin, lockdown, grapple, suppress)
Durable, organized front line supported by technicians
Strong command aura and morale reliability
Scoring through removal/extraction rather than pure attrition
weaknesses: Can be outmaneuvered by extreme mobility and deep infiltration
Arrest plans can collapse if key control pieces fall
Less flexible in highly mystical play without dedicated counters
High-value assets can become liabilities if lost early

preferred_states.reason: The Corps’ ideal end-state: cleared lanes, enforced exclusion, and the battlefield made compliant for development.
Stable, controlled zones reward disciplined expansion and checkpoint play.

neutral_states.reason: The Corps treats it as under-policed territory—more paperwork, more arrests.
Operationally unpleasant, but the Corps fields respirators and procedures for toxic environments.

opposed_states.reason: Uncontrolled ecology and monster proliferation undermines stabilization and infrastructure.
Haunts and occult contamination disrupt procedure and complicate containment.
Competing sovereignty and mystic law interferes with federal authority.
Monsterology’s exploitation turns the park into a scarred theft-zone—hostile to lawful oversight.
Automation-heavy dead zones reduce the Corps’ leverage against living hazards and complicate arrests.

ideal_scenarios: Escort of survey teams and rail crews
challenging_scenarios: Deeply mystical battlefields without clear lines
Monster-swarm scenarios that overwhelm arrest capacity

weapons_note: Unit costs include standard-issue weapons. Where a weapon/property grants an explicit rules effect, it is included below as weapon_effects for that unit.

faction_features.name: Federal Exclusion Jurisdiction
faction_features.effect: Liberty Corps treats Coffin Canyon as a Forbidden National Park under federal control. Their operations prioritize stabilization, eviction, and removal of unlawful presences.

faction_features.name: Arrest & Extraction Doctrine
faction_features.effect: Liberty Corps specializes in restraining and removing targets rather than simply destroying them. Units with Grapple/Binding Rig/Lockdown excel at creating arrests; transport units convert arrests into secure removals and scoring.

faction_features.name: Procedure Is Patriotism
faction_features.effect: Command presence (Authority/Inspire/Signal Orders) keeps units coordinated and resistant to morale disruption—so long as the chain of command remains intact.

units.name: Patriot Asset

weapon_effects.name: Improvised Restraints
weapon_effects.effect: Counts as suitable gear for arrests and prisoner handling where scenario rules require restraints.

abilities.name: Runner
abilities.effect: If no attacks are made during activation, make an additional Move at the end.

units.lore: Cheap bodies in cheap uniforms—pressed into service, promised glory, issued a whistle and a pair of cuffs.
units.tactics: Flood lanes, contest objectives, and enable arrests. Trade lives for time and position.

units.name: Steam Constable

weapon_effects.name: Baton Interdiction
weapon_effects.effect: Designed for arrests: pair with Grapple/Lockdown to prevent disengage and set up prisoner capture.

abilities.name: Grapple
abilities.effect: On hit, pull target 3" toward self; target cannot move next activation.

abilities.name: Shield Wall
abilities.effect: +1 Defense while adjacent to another Shield Wall model; no bonus vs Blast.

units.lore: Uniformed enforcers in slab-wool coats and iron helmets. Steam packs drive piston-fists built for arrests, not duels.
units.tactics: Frontline control. Grapple and Shield Wall make lanes sticky, enabling arrests and denying breakthroughs.

units.name: Field Technician

weapon_effects.name: Shock Stick
weapon_effects.effect: Useful for discouraging close threats while the Technician keeps assets operational.

abilities.name: Assistant
abilities.effect: May assist an adjacent Mystic or Scientist with special activations.

abilities.name: Repair
abilities.effect: Restore 1 damage to an adjacent friendly vehicle/device/mechanical unit by consuming Spare Parts.

abilities.name: Kick the Machine
abilities.effect: Remove one debuff (Hex, Stagger, Suppression, Pinned) from an adjacent friendly unit.

units.lore: Cable-haulers and wrench-hands who keep Liberty Corps machinery alive in places it was never meant to operate.
units.tactics: Support backbone. Keep vehicles and control pieces functioning; strip debuffs at key moments.

units.name: Liberty Corps Detective

weapon_effects.name: Pinning Shot
weapon_effects.effect: On hit, target cannot move during its next activation.

abilities.name: Runner
abilities.effect: If no attacks are made during activation, make an additional Move at the end.

abilities.name: Mark Target
abilities.effect: Once per game: choose one enemy in LoS; that target takes +1 damage from all sources until end of round.

abilities.name: Third Eye Vision
abilities.effect: Reveal hidden units within 12"; can see Stealth units; ignores Fog/Smoke for targeting.

units.lore: Plain clothes, keen eyes, documented everything. The warrant is already drafted—signed, stamped, inevitable.
units.tactics: Priority marking and lane control. Use pinning to set up arrests and prevent escapes.

units.name: Warrant Officer

weapon_effects.name: Restraint Rig
weapon_effects.effect: Built to convert contact into containment—best used immediately after a successful Grapple.

abilities.name: Fast
abilities.effect: +2" to base movement.

abilities.name: Grapple
abilities.effect: On hit, pull target 3" toward self; target cannot move next activation.

abilities.name: Binding Rig
abilities.effect: On successful Grapple vs Brute or Monster type: target becomes Restrained (cannot move or attack until freed or this unit dies).

abilities.name: Tough
abilities.effect: When taking damage, roll 1 die per damage; each 5+ ignores 1 damage.

units.lore: The best at what they do: steam-assisted reflexes, reinforced armor, and a perfect arrest record.
units.tactics: Mobile arrest specialist. Fast + Grapple + Binding Rig is the Corps’ cleanest capture package.

units.name: Marksman Contractor

abilities.name: Deadeye
abilities.effect: Once per game: re-roll all failed dice on a single ranged attack.

abilities.name: Mark Target
abilities.effect: Once per game: choose one enemy in LoS; that target takes +1 damage from all sources until end of round.

units.lore: Contract shooters attached to enforcement columns. Their job isn’t justice—it’s results, recorded and delivered.
units.tactics: Delete or cripple key pieces. Mark targets to concentrate fire and force compliance.

units.name: Riot Harmonist

weapon_effects.name: Sonic
weapon_effects.effect: Ignores Cover; may cause Deafening/Disorientation where applicable.

weapon_effects.name: Blast
weapon_effects.effect: 3" radius area attack; roll separately for each model; Cover applies normally unless ignored.

abilities.name: Audio Suppression
abilities.effect: Enemies within 6" suffer -1 to Morale checks.

abilities.name: Signal Orders
abilities.effect: One friendly unit within 12" may immediately move 3".

units.lore: A brass-backed crowd-control officer. Used for signaling, dispersal, and breaking resolve with weaponized sound.
units.tactics: Area denial + morale pressure. Best behind the line, shaping movement and punishing clustered units.

units.name: Liberty Corps Judge

weapon_effects.name: Pinning Shot
weapon_effects.effect: On hit, target cannot move during its next activation.

abilities.name: Authority
abilities.effect: Friendly units within 6" ignore Suppression effects.

abilities.name: Inspire
abilities.effect: Friendly units within 6" gain +1 to Morale checks.

abilities.name: Pass Judgment
abilities.effect: Once per game: target one enemy within 12". Until end of game, that unit suffers -1 to all Defense rolls; Liberty Corps may reroll 1s when attacking it.

units.lore: In Liberty Corps jurisdiction, Judges hold executive power in the field. They prosecute, sentence, and enforce—cleanly, publicly, and without appeal.
units.tactics: Command anchor. Keeps the line steady and selects one enemy to become the example.

units.name: Black Mariah

weapon_effects.name: Restraint Winch
weapon_effects.effect: Ideal for collecting arrested/prisoner targets and converting control into removal/extraction.

abilities.name: Cargo Hold
abilities.effect: Transport up to 4 Rangers OR 1 medium Monster OR 2 objectives; load/unload requires base contact and one activation.

abilities.name: Mobile Cell Block
abilities.effect: Transports Captured models. If destroyed, prisoners are released.

abilities.name: Armored
abilities.effect: Reduce damage taken by 1 (minimum 0); does not affect terrain/environmental damage.

units.lore: A steam-powered armored prison wagon. It doesn’t bring help. It brings jurisdiction.
units.tactics: Scoring engine and denial piece. Collect, transport, and secure removals—protect it or your captures spill back into the fight.

units.name: Classified Asset: Troll-Howitzer

weapon_effects.name: Massive Blast
weapon_effects.effect: 6" radius area attack; roll separately for each model; Cover applies normally.

weapon_effects.name: Universal Terror
weapon_effects.effect: When this unit fires: ALL units (friendly AND enemy) within 12" must test Morale.

abilities.name: Mismanaged Asset
abilities.effect: If this unit is destroyed before Round 4, your faction loses 5 Victory Points.

abilities.name: Armored
abilities.effect: Reduce damage taken by 1 (minimum 0).

abilities.name: Steadfast
abilities.effect: Failed Morale results in normal failure, never Panic.

units.lore: A restrained monster fused to artillery hardware. It fires because it hurts. It exists because paperwork said it could.
units.tactics: Deterrence through escalation. Every shot reshapes morale; protect it until it has done its work.

units.name: Uncle Liberty

weapon_effects.name: Savage Impact
weapon_effects.effect: Moving 3"+ into contact deals 3 automatic hits before rolling attack dice.

abilities.name: Inspire
abilities.effect: Friendly units within 6" gain +1 to Morale checks.

abilities.name: Fear
abilities.effect: Enemies within 6" suffer -1 die on Morale tests.

abilities.name: Regeneration
abilities.effect: At start of activation, heal 1 wound on a 5+.

abilities.name: Unyielding
abilities.effect: Cannot be pushed/pulled/repositioned by enemy abilities.

units.lore: The first President of the United States of Liberty. A living symbol of national resolve, sustained beyond mortality by steam, steel, and duty. He is not deployed lightly. He is a national response asset.
units.tactics: Catastrophic closer. When he arrives, it’s no longer a negotiation—it's national compliance.

special_rules.national_response_asset: Scenario/roster rules may restrict or condition Uncle Liberty’s inclusion (campaign escalation, high point thresholds, or special missions).
special_rules.insane_contingency: If your core rules include Uncle Liberty becoming uncontrollable, place that rule here in your master faction file so it stays consistent across apps.

optional_upgrades_note: Liberty Corps commonly fields respirators, goggles, and hardened kit for toxic operations. If your universal upgrades include Gas Mask / Built-In Respirator / Built-In Goggles, apply them via your shared upgrade system rather than duplicating here.
